bioghist.p: Mary Bartol Theiss was the daughter of William Cyrus Bartol, a professor at Bucknell University, and his wife, who was active in the Shikelimo Chapter of the Pennsylvania Daughters of the American Revolution and curator of the Union County Historical Society. She was married to Lewis Edwin Theiss, also a Bucknell faculty member. Theiss and her husband were active in documenting local and Bucknell history.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of documentation related to genealogical and historical research and activities, primarily of Theiss's mother, Mrs. W. C. Bartol. The collection includes correspondence and datasheets related to the Shikelimo Chapter of the Pennsylvania Daughters of the American Revolution. Most notable among these are War Service Records related to World War I service of individual soldiers. There is also DAR correspondence related to historical markers and historical and genealogical topics. The collection also includes: correspondence with the Union County Historical Society on creation of a historical marker for Revolutionary War soldiers killed at that spot in 1780; miscellaneous correspondence on personal and historical topics; notes and correspondence related to various families, including descendents of Elizabeth More Clark; photocopies of information on Lewisburg Cemetery in Williamsport, Pennsylvania, and miscellaneous historical topics; information on marriages and records (including records at Prothonotary's Office in Union County); and correspondence and reports of the Luzerne County War History Committee (related to World War I).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
